Frequently Asked Questions

  • What is MakerGirl?
  • How do I register?
  • Where do the sessions happen?
  • How do I request a refund?
  • Can groups attend MakerGirl sessions?
  • Are there scholarships available?

What is MakerGirl?

MakerGirl brings 3D printing, Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) to life for girls to start creating anything they want in their lives.
MakerGirl sessions are for girls aged 7-10 and are led by university STEM women. All of our sessions teach young girls 3D printing, while also teaching them about women leaders in STEM fields, innovative companies, cutting edge technology, and much more. We want your MakerGirl to come to our session and depart wanting to actively participate in any and all parts of STEM!

How do I register?

You can register through the MakerGirl Eventbrite

Where do the sessions happen?

University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign: Business Instructional Facility, Room 3030, 515 East Gregory Avenue Champaign, IL 61820
Southern Illinois University: Marion Mall, 3000 W. Deyoung Street, No. 604, Marion, IL 62959

How do I request a refund?

Go to Eventbrite, view your ticket, and request a refund!

Can groups attend MakerGirl sessions?

Yes! Please email info@makergirl.us for reserving spots for groups and for group pricing

Are there scholarships available?

Yes, absolutely! Families that qualify for subsidized lunches or other serious financial constraints may qualify for scholarships. Email info@makergirl.us for scholarship requests! Please state 1) how you qualify 2) your MakerGirl(s) name 3) the session(s) that you want your MakerGirl(s) to attend!
